intro: Leucanthemella linearis, commonly known as the slender white ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some regions.
